name: Pundt's tuco-tuco
description: Pundt's tuco-tuco is a species of rodent in the family Ctenomyidae. It is endemic to the Pampas of southern CÃ³rdoba and San Luis Provinces in central Argentina. The species is named after Argentine landowner and collector Moritz Pundt. It has a fragmented population and is threatened by conversion of its habitat to agricultural use.
